data.text: @VictimOfMaths Bigger peaks to fall from? As before, I'm interested in overall stress and occupancy in hospitals. How does it compare to pre Sars Cov2 period. Statistically surely that has to have an impact one way or the other?
@VictimOfMaths Thanks for Heatmaps - so much easier!
@VictimOfMaths Seems like the elderly are suffering from vaccine waning immunity. Another booster will not end the pandemic, but could save many lives. https://t.co/pN4S1ySAwV
@VictimOfMaths My suspicion is older people are completely done with being careful while there is still an awful lot of Covid around in schools/community in areas that escaped before
@VictimOfMaths Great chart, easy to read once I wrapped my head around it.

R code for these plots is here:
https://t.co/inQl3pwH73

Obviously some confounding with people being admitted 'with' COVID not 'for' it, but cases have fallen similarly fast after both peaks, I think.

Here are both plots as heatmaps if that's more your kind of thing: https://t.co/LWARhiABMr
Compare and contrast with the speed with which things fell back last winter. Note the change in the colour scale, because things were *much* worse back then. https://t.co/cwxHywpyP9
